foul.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a foul smell or taste is very unpleasant
foul.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He woke up with a foul taste in his mouth.
He put down his mug of foul-tasting coffee.
foul.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Refugees in the camps are short of food and at risk from foul water.
extractor fans to remove foul air from the tunnel
foul.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: foul weather is stormy and windy, with a lot of rain or snow
foul.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Always carry foul weather gear when you go out walking.
foul.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if a sports player fouls another player, they do something that is not allowed by the rules
foul.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to hit a ball outside the limit of the playing area in baseball
foul.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to make something very dirty, especially with waste
foul.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: rivers and lakes fouled almost beyond recovery by pollutants
foul.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: an action in a sport that is against the rules
foul.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Wright was booked for a foul on the goalkeeper.
foul.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a hit in baseball which goes outside the limits of the playing area
